message_2:
To simplify the expression, we will subtract the terms of the second polynomial from the terms of the first polynomial.

(3x² + 2x - 1) - (2x² - 3x + 4)

First, distribute the negative sign to each term in the second polynomial:

3x² + 2x - 1 - 2x² + 3x - 4

Now, combine like terms:

(3x² - 2x²) + (2x + 3x) + (-1 - 4)

1x² + 5x - 5

So, the simplified expression is:

x² + 5x - 5
